intro: Lamanonia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lamanonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are typically pink or white and bloom in the spring. Lamanonia cuneata is well adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
